mainTopic.title: Mitral stenosis
mainTopic.content_info: The materials for the topics can be found in the uploaded pdf files. The informations about the different topics listed on the ppt pages are sometimes limited and do not contain the necessary amount of content because of it's dense format, therefore it does not include every information but serves as a great foundation to form the questions and provide focus on core content, however additional background knowledge is needed to create quality revision quizzes.

quizzes.question: What is the most common etiology for mitral stenosis?
What is the fundamental problem with mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Inability to get blood from left atrium to the left ventricle
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Inability to get blood from right atrium to the right ventricle
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Inability to get blood from left ventricle to the left atrium
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Inability to get blood from right ventricle to the right atrium
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Inability to get blood from left atrium to the right ventricle

quizzes.question: What is the stenotic process in mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Scarring and fibrosis of leaflets and chordae tendineae, which causes a commissural fusion. This leads to funnel-shaped orifice and pressure gradient across the valve.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: The total stroke volume increases, so more blood is pumped from the left ventricle to the left atrium. This leads to a ventricular remodelling, so the left ventricle enlarges.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: A specific mutation in the COL2A gen causes an error in the folding of collagen. This leads to an incorrect formation of the mitral valve and thus creating a funnel shaped orifice and pressure gradient across the valve.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Due to a bacterial endocarditis, the valves are damaged by the pathogens. This leads to the changes on the surface of the valve, the outcome is the narrowing of the intervalvular space.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: It only occurs in people with a congenital bicuspidal mitral valve. In this case, instead of 3, there are 2 leaflets, which causes the narrowing of the intervalvular space.

quizzes.question: What are the consequences of the elevated left atrial pressure in mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Left atrial enlargement, blood stasis may lead to atrial thrombus formation and embolism, development of atrial fibrillation
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Left ventricular enlargement, blood stasis may lead to ventricular thrombus formation and embolism, development of ventricular fibrillation
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Left atrial enlargement, blood stasis may lead to atrial thrombus formation and embolism, development of atrial fluttern
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Left atrial enlargement, blood stasis may lead to atrial thrombus formation and embolism, development of ventricular fibrillation
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Left atrial enlargement, blood stasis may lead to ventricular thrombus formation and embolism, development of ventricular tachycardia

quizzes.question: What are the consequences of the elevated pulmonary vein pressure in mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Leads to pulmonary artery hypertension, then right ventricular hypertrophy and dilation
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Leads to pulmonary artery thrombosis, then right ventricular hypertrophy and dilation
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Leads to pulmonary artery hypertension, then right atrial hypertrophy and dilation
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Leads to aortic hypertension, then right ventricular hypertrophy and dilation
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Leads to aortic hypertension, then left ventricular hypertrophy and dilation

quizzes.question: How is the severity of mitral stenosis determined?
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: By assessing the left ventricular ejection fraction
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: By evaluating the size of the left atrium
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: By checking for the presence of a heart murmur

quizzes.question: How do the symptoms worsen with the severity of mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Typically asymptomatic, dyspnea with marked effort, dyspnea with minimal effort, orthopnea, paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea, orthopnea, dyspnea with minimal effort, dyspnea with marked effort, typically asymptomatic
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Typically asymptomatic, orthopnea, paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea, dyspnea with minimal effort, dyspnea with marked effort
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Dyspnea with minimal effort, dyspnea with marked effort, typically asymptomatic, orthopnea, paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Dyspnea with minimal effort, dyspnea with marked effort, paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea, orthopnea, typically asymptomatic

quizzes.question: Why is fatigue common in mitral stenosis?
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Due to increased blood pressure in the lungs, which decreases oxygen supply to the muscles
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Because the heart is pumping too much blood, leading to exhaustion
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Due to increased heart rate causing dehydration and weakness
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Because of low levels of red blood cells, leading to poor oxygen delivery to tissues

quizzes.question: What are the findings during auscultation in mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Accentuated first heart sound, opening snap, diastolic rumble
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Midsystolic click,  late systolic murmur, opening snap
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Holosystolic murmur, accentuated first heart sound, midsystolic click
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Crescendo-decrescendo systolic murmur, accentuated second heart sound, closing snap
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Proto-meso-systolic murmur, midsystolic click, opening snap

quizzes.question: Which methods are used to diagnose mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Chest x-ray, electrocardiography, echocardiography, cardiac catheterization
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Open heart surgery, electrocardiography, echocardiography, cardiac catheterization
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Chest x-ray, open heart surgery, echocardiography, cardiac catheterization
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Chest x-ray, electrocardiography, open heart surgery, cardiac catheterization
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Chest x-ray, electrocardiography, echocardiography, open heart surgery

quizzes.question: What are the findings on chest x-ray in mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Double density right cardiac border, convexity just below the left pulmonary artery, elevated left main bronchus, Kerley lines
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Triple density right cardiac border, concavity just below the right pulmonary artery, elevated right main bronchus, Tawara lines
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Double density right cardiac border, convexity just below the right pulmonary artery, elevated right main bronchus, His lines
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Double density right cardiac border, convexity just below the left pulmonary artery, depressed left main bronchus, Purkinje lines
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Double density right cardiac border, concavity just below the left pulmonary artery, depressed left main bronchus, Aschoff lines

quizzes.question: What are the findings with echocardiography in mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Increased left atrial size, doming of valve leaflets, valve stenosis, valve area can be planimetered
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Decreased left atrial size, doming of valve leaflets, valve regurgitation, valve area can be planimetered
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Increased right atrial size, doming of valve leaflets, valve stenosis, valve area can be planimetered
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Decreased left ventricular size, doming of valve leaflets, valve stenosis, valve area can be planimetered
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Increased right ventricular size, doming of valve leaflets, valve stenosis, valve area can be planimetered

quizzes.question: In which cases is a cardiac catheterization indicated in the diagnosis of mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Symptoms disproportionate to objective evidence, other forms of heart disease suspected, mitral regurgitation of uncertain degree
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: History of hypertension, asymptomatic patient, routine screening for heart disease
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Regular chest pain without other findings, history of stroke, normal electrocardiogram
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Signs of anemia, history of diabetes, no significant valve dysfunction on echocardiography
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Family history of coronary artery disease, unexplained weight loss, routine pre-surgery clearance is needed for unrelated procedures

quizzes.question: What is the differential diagnosis of mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Atrial myxoma, cor triatriatum, and congenital mitral stenosis
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Coronary artery disease, pericarditis, and left ventricular hypertrophy
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Dilated cardiomyopathy, heart failure, and aortic stenosis
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Pulmonary embolism, tricuspid regurgitation, and right ventricular failure
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Endocarditis, atrial fibrillation, and ventricular septal defect

quizzes.question: Which antibiotic is used as secundary prevention in mitral stenosis?
Which medications are used to treat mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Anticoagulation against thromboembolism, diuretics for congestion, rate control for atrial fibrillation
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Anticoagulation for congestion, diuretics against thromboembolism, rate control for atrial fibrillation
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Anticoagulation against thromboembolism, diuretics for atrial fibrillation, rate control for congestion
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Anticoagulation for atrial fibrillation, diuretics against thromboembolism, rate control for congestion
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Anticoagulation for congestion, diuretics for atrial fibrillation, rate control against thromboembolism

quizzes.question: Which methods are used as a mechanical relief in mitral stenosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Closed surgical commissurotomy, Open surgical commissurotomy, Valve replacement, Balloon mitral commissurotomy
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG), Aortic valve replacement, Cardiac resynchronization therapy, Left ventricular assist device (LVAD) implantation
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Pulmonary artery catheterization, Endovenous laser therapy (EVLT), Balloon angioplasty for coronary disease, Temporary pacemaker insertion
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Defibrillator implantation, Transcatheter aortic valve implantation (TAVI), Left ventricular assist device (LVAD) implantation, Pulmonary artery catheterization
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Endovenous laser therapy (EVLT), Left ventricular assist device (LVAD) implantation, Coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG), Pacemaker implantation
